title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
Unfortunately no history, customer bought the laptop cheap thinking he could just swap out the battery.

If I unplug the power it tells me the battery is low and it will sleep soon. Coconut doesn't see the battery at all.

Considering it technically can run off the battery, I'm looking at the data lines.


D7050::1 = 3v08 - 3v3
D7050::2 = 2.189

R7050 = ok.
R7060 = ok.
R7150 = ok.

C7050 = ::1 2v2
C7060 = ::1 2v2

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Bad ISL or SMC.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: How can I test for this?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: You can't. Start with the ISL and pray, but count on a dead SMC too.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Orange light and no fan spin with the new ISL. :/

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Well then you screwed it up. Check soldering and or replace again.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Inspect your soldering job, it was working before replacement so....

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
I redid the soldering and all looks okay.

There is no draw now though. The adapter is only giving 0.5v.

All fuses look okay. I haven't seen this before, any suggestions?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Soldering can be fine, but the chip is dead. Redo the whole thing.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Do you know if an ISL from an 820-3462 will work on that 820-3476 board?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: yes, as long as it says ISL6259AHRTZ on it. and agreed with duke & aprendiz that this must be fucked up soldering or something else knoccked off as it was working before.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
Thanks, I'll swap it shortly.

Soldering the first time round a bit rough, but the second time was pretty solid. ISL came off a donor board though so I'll try one I know worked before looking further.
Thanks again.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
Swapped it out again, soldering is definitely ok this time (no really, I swear).

What does it mean when there is only 0.470v on PP18v_DCIN_FUSE?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: R7012 is reading 61k and should be 1k...

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
R7012 is supposed to be 68K, so 61K in circuit is 99% probably fine.

Looks like adapter is shutting down or not turning on. Do you have a fake adapter to test with?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
You're right.
I must have had the wrong PDF open. :/

I don't have a fake charger here unfortunately.


/taps fingers on desk.
I'll have to try make a plan somehow...

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Check for shorts on the DCIN bus and PPBUS. Also get a fake charger for testing, they are sometimes handy.

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
Dead Short. As in 0.000. :/

How do I work out where the short is?
Guessing I remove a component in the middle somewhere and see which side still has the short then repeat?

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
In Diode mode on R7005;

::1 = 0.000v
::2 = 0.004v

So would this mean the short is on the pin 1 side?
(trying to make sure I'm doing this right)

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: R7005 is on the PPBUS not DCIN. But I guess PPBUS is shorted now. Measure in Ohms the resistance to GND on PPBUS

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message:
0 ohms on Pin 1
10 ohms on Pin 2

title: 820-3476 Doesn't sense battery.
message: Short can be anywhere on the bus, inject voltage and see what current does. Start low cause the short is pretty low Ohm so should draw lots of amps quick. I expect something in the ISL area to heat up as that was messed with.
